# selectNext(_:)

**Instance Method**

Selects the next object, relative to the current selection, in the receiver’s arranged content.

## Declaration

```swift
@IBAction @MainActor func selectNext(_ sender: Any?)
```

## Discussion

The `sender` is typically the object that invoked this method.

### Special Considerations

Beginning with OS X v10.4 the result of this method is deferred until the next iteration of the runloop so that the error presentation mechanism (see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/ErrorHandlingCocoa/ErrorRespondRecover/ErrorRespondRecover.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40001806-CH203]) can provide feedback as a sheet.

## Managing selections

- **selectionIndex**: The index of the first object in the receiver’s selection
- **setSelectionIndex(_:)**: Sets the receiver’s selection to the given index, and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the selection was changed.
- **selectsInsertedObjects**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver automatically selects inserted objects
- **setSelectionIndexes(_:)**: Sets the receiver’s selection indexes and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the selection changed.
- **selectionIndexes**: An index set containing the indexes of the receiver’s currently selected objects in the content array
- **addSelectionIndexes(_:)**: Adds the objects at the specified indexes in the receiver’s content array to the current selection.
- **removeSelectionIndexes(_:)**: Removes the object as the specified indexes from the receiver’s current selection.
- **setSelectedObjects(_:)**: Sets the specified objects as the receiver’s current selection.
- **selectedObjects**: An array containing the receiver’s selected objects
- **addSelectedObjects(_:)**: Adds the specified objects from the receiver’s content array to the current selection.
- **removeSelectedObjects(_:)**: Removes the specified objects from the receiver’s current selection.
- **canSelectNext**: A Boolean value indicating whether the next object, relative to the current selection, in the receiver’s content array can be selected
- **selectPrevious(_:)**: Selects the previous object, relative to the current selection, in the receiver’s arranged content.
- **canSelectPrevious**: A Boolean value indicating whether the previous object, relative to the current selection, in the receiver’s content array can be selected
